did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Methodist Episcopal Church of Dresden records, 1827-1929

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Methodist Episcopal Church of Dresden (Dresden, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: One volume register (1827-1929), a leader's and a steward's book (1869-1908), one volume of quarterly conference records (1868-1903), a Sunday school register (1859-1873), one volume of Ladies Benevolent Society meeting minutes (1855-1877), and one volume of financial records concerning the construction of the church (1830-1832).

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1827 Methodist circuit riders began to hold services in Dresden when it became a charge on the Crooked Lake circuit. The society began to collect funds, in 1829 to buy a lot and build a church. The church was completed in 1832. The first class of the Methodist Episcopal Church of Dresden was organized in 1831. The church was sold to Baptists during a low period for the Methodist Episcopal society. No trustee or board meetings were held between 1841-1848. A board meeting in the Presbyterian church reorganized the church March 21, 1848 and by April 1848 the church had purchased their old church from the Baptist society.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: One volume register (1827-1929), a leader's and a steward's book (1869-1908), one volume of quarterly conference records (1868-1903), a Sunday school register (1859-1873), one volume of Ladies Benevolent Society meeting minutes (1855-1877), and one volume of financial records concerning the construction of the church (1830-1832).
